summary: No joking, my theory about Avengers: endgame is that Dr Strange knew there was another future where everyone lived, but...
body: No joking, my theory about Avengers: endgame is that Dr Strange knew there was another future where everyone lived, but consciously decided to push Tony under the bus because of that time he told him he only makes Ballon animals.

summary: How Avengers: Endgame impacts Marvel's Loki TV series
title: How Avengers: Endgame impacts Marvel's Loki TV series
description:
While topping Avengers: Infinity War might’ve seemed like a Vormir-sized mountain to climb, Joe and Anthony Russo did it with style in Avengers: Endgame. Tying together the first 22 movies of the Marvel Cinematic Universe with a spandex bow, the Russos dutifully journeyed through the past, present and future to unite those we’ve come to love and lose since 2008’s Iron Man.

Alongside cameos from the likes of Rene Russo’s Frigga, Robert Redford’s Alexander Pierce, Tilda Swinton’s Ancient One, Hayley Atwell’s Peggy Carter, and Ty Simpkins’ Harley Keener, fandom was on its feet for the return of Tom Hiddleston as Loki. But, what does *that* big Endgame scene mean for the Trickster God moving forward?

With Team Tony making the most of Ant-Man’s Quantum Realm knowledge and the bulging brains of Stark and Banner, the OG Avengers and a few later additions stuck on their snazzy new uniforms and travelled through time to collect the Infinity Stones for their own golden glove.

Returning to the climax of 2012’s Battle of New York, audiences saw a muzzled Loki being led away to a life behind bars. The important twist came when 2024 Iron Man’s plan went awry and 2012 Hulk knocked him to the ground. This sent the Tesseract skidding across the floor and saw Loki seize his chance to grab it and vanish into thin air.

Loki’s Endgame arc doesn’t see him return to the land of the living, but it does open the door for his potential return.

Those who were ‘dusted’ in Thanos’ snap were (probably) always destined to come back, the likes of Heimdall, Gamora, Vision and Loki dying outside “The Decimation” left a question mark over all their futures – and Thanos’ sombre statement of “no resurrections this time” means Infinity War Loki is almost certainly still dead, thanks to his heroic act of defiance against the Mad Titan.

But considering the synopsis of the Disney+ Loki TV series teases Thor’s unruly brother darting through history to meddle with key events, it sounds like the botched Infinity Stone plan has given Loki the reprieve everyone had hoped for.  

The Tesseract’s powers to transport Loki to wherever he wants might seem handy, but it still doesn’t explain how he can seemingly leap through time. That being said, Loki’s splintered reality could easily see him head to pick up the Time Stone or learn to use the Quantum Realm without affecting the Prime Universe of Endgame’s *erm* endgame.

Let’s remember just how bad-ass old Loki used to be, how he once disguised himself as Odin and managed to convince Thor that he was Asgard’s eye-patched ruler. Hiddleston has brilliantly shown the character’s cunning and put Loki up there with the likes of Stark and Banner as one of the MCU’s mightiest minds. This means it shouldn’t be too much of a stretch for Loki to figure out how to combine the might of the Space Stone with the ability of time travel.

There may have been various theories that Infinity War Loki somehow found a way to fake his death (again), but the idea of alternate Loki is much more interesting.

Not only does the Space Stone give Disney+ a way to reintroduce Loki without retconning his death, or being confined by the limits of a prequel show, but this Loki is just like the Quill-kicking 2014 Gamora in that he hasn’t been mellowed by the traumatic events of  later MCU movies.

A reset of sorts for the character, it’s sure to rattle those fans who’ve come to love Loki over the years. For the rest of us though, without his redemptive arcs of Thor: The Dark World, Thor: Ragnarok and Avengers: Infinity War, we get to enjoy Loki back at his villainous best.

slug: จ-กรวาลภาพยนตร-มาร-เวล-ความสำเร-จท-ยากจะเล-ยนแบบ
tags: นพปฎล พลศิลป์
หรรษาวันจันทร์
summary: จักรวาลภาพยนตร์มาร์เวล ความสำเร็จที่ยากจะเลียนแบบ แต่ใครๆ ก็อยากทำตาม
title: จักรวาลภาพยนตร์มาร์เวล ความสำเร็จที่ยากจะเลียนแบบ แต่ใครๆ ก็อยากทำตาม
body:
จักรวาลภาพยนตร์มาร์เวล ความสำเร็จที่ยากจะเลียนแบบ แต่ใครๆ ก็อยากทำตาม

หลังเปิดตัวด้วยIron Man ที่ได้ชื่อว่าเป็นจุดเริ่มต้นของจักรวาลภาพยนตร์มาร์เวลเมื่อปี2008ในที่สุดเรื่องราวที่ได้ชื่อว่า เป็นบทหนึ่งในจักรวาลซูเปอร์ฮีโรอันแสนยิ่งใหญ่ของมาร์เวล สตูดิโอส์ค่ายภาพยนตร์ที่เติบโตมาจากการทำหนังสือการ์ตูนหรือนิยายภาพ ก็เดินทางมาถึงภาพยนตร์เรื่องสำคัญAvengers: Endgameที่ว่ากันว่าเป็นบทสรุปเรื่องราวในยุคแรกของจักรวาลภาพยนตร์มาร์เวล ซึ่งเริ่มต้นกันเมื่อ 10ปีที่แล้ว…

View On WordPress

body:
So I posted some pictures of Chris Evans and Sebastian Stan and my post has been hidden as tumblr thinks it goes against their rules or whatever.

So your telling me their TOO sexy for tumblr now.


How am I still living.

So I posted some pictures of Chris Evans and Sebastian Stan and my post has been hidden as tumblr thinks it goes against their rules or whatever.

So your telling me their TOO sexy for tumblr now.


How am I still living.

summary: Según un estudio, Thor sería obeso
title: Según un estudio, Thor sería obeso
body:
Con el furor que está causando la película ‘Avengers: Endgame’, todo el foco está puesto en los superhéroes. Y un estudio reciente llamado Captain Dorito and the bombshell: Supernormal stimuli in comics and film (Capitán Dorito y la bomba: estímulos sobrenaturales en cómics y películas) halló un dato sorprendente acerca de la fisionomía y el peso de los protagonistas de los cómics.

Tiemblan Thor y Capitán América

Profesionales de las universidades de Binghamton y SUNY Oswego, en los Estados Unidos, recolectaron datos del índice de masa corporal (BMI) de 3,752 superhéroes de Marvel (mujeres y hombres).

Descubrieron que los superhéroes de cómics masculinos eran obesos, mientras que las mujeres tenían un promedio de peso de normal a bajo.

En los superhéroes masculinos se encontró una musculatura extrema en la parte superior del cuerpo, con proporciones de hombros y cintura muy por encima de los límites humanos. En cambio, los cuerpos de los superhéroes femeninos se mostraban por debajo debajo del peso de las mujeres reales, con proporciones de cintura a cadera mucho más bajas que la de los humanos promedio, aclaran en el sitio de la Universidad de Binghamton.

También te puede interesar:  ‘Avengers: Endgame’ rompe récord de taquilla con debut global de 1.200 millones de dólares

“Las formas hipermasculinas e hiperfemeninas de los personajes de los cómics son un reflejo exagerado de los marcadores endocrinos que indican juventud, salud y fertilidad en humanos reales”, dijo Laura Johnsen, líder del estudio y estudiante de doctorado de la Universidad de Binghamton.

Es decir, que a la hora de crear estos personajes, se enfatizan todas las características físicas que las personas encuentran atractivas en el cuerpo humano.

Ver esta publicación en Instagram

Nothing can prepare you for the endgame. Marvel Studios’ #AvengersEndgame is now playing in theaters. Get your tickets now (link in bio)

Una publicación compartida de Marvel Studios (@marvelstudios) el 4 May, 2019 a las 10:30 PDT

“Las personas que leen cómics saben que este tipo de cuerpos son representaciones fantásticas de la forma humana”, señaló y agregó: “Está bastante claro que no puedes lograr ese tipo de siluetas solo con dieta y ejercicio. Incluso, para las películas, los diseñadores de vestuario tienen que modificar los disfraces para que los actores se vean aún más robustos de lo que realmente son en la vida real”.

También te puede interesar: Directores de “Avengers: Endgame” piden al público: “No sean aguafiestas”

“Los cómics y las películas de superhéroes a veces son trivializados como ‘cosas de niños’, pero cada vez ofrecen más historias detalladas, creativas y arte fino. También, reflejan emociones y deseos humanos profundos. Al estudiarlos desde una perspectiva evolutiva, obtenemos información sobre los orígenes subyacentes de por qué los personajes se ven así, por qué nos sentimos atraídos por ellos y por qué nos conectamos con ellos a un nivel tan personal”, destacó la investigadora.

summary: We had to design a poster for homework, and I thought it might be fun to make one for Captain Marvel. The red gloved fist was a...
body:
We had to design a poster for homework, and I thought it might be fun to make one for Captain Marvel. The red gloved fist was a reference to one of my favourite shots in the movie (her clenching her fist each time she picks herself up from the ground), as well as Carol’s pose on the cover of Kelly Sue Deconnick’s iconic comic run. It’s also where I got the slogan on the fingers. (The movie’s marketing campaign has used a version of it, but I like the original more because, like Carol, it doesn’t settle for less.) I also enjoy that it looks a bit like Thanos’ gauntlet, kind of signifying just how much power she herself has.

The colours were a reference to her costume’s colours, while the style was more of a reference to the more 50’s inspired pop art style of The Incredibles, since I really love that aesthetic.

I also enjoy that it looks a bit like Thanos’ gauntlet, kind of signifying just how much power she herself has.

The colours were a reference to her costume’s colours, while the style was more of a reference to the more 50’s inspired pop art style of The Incredibles, since I really love that aesthetic.

The colours were a reference to her costume’s colours, while the style was more of a reference to the more 50’s inspired pop art style of The Incredibles, since I really love that aesthetic.

The colours were a reference to her costume’s colours, while the style was more of a reference to the more 50’s inspired pop art style of The Incredibles, since I really love that aesthetic.
